intro: Polyphlebium diaphanum, commonly known as the transparent moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, translucent leaves that give it a unique appearance. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its structure consists of closely arranged, slender shoots with small, elongated leaves. Polyphlebium diaphanum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its ecosystem.
